topic.title: Allocating dedicated proxy, account, container server (PAC)

body.p: A dedicated proxy, account and container (PAC) server is a node that runs the swift-proxy, swift-account and swift-container services. It is used to respond to API requests and to store account and container data. This type of node does not store object data.

The procedure described in this section is used to allocate Swift object servers during the initial deployment of the system. Once the system has been deployed, a different procedure is used to add additional Swift object servers.
To allocate Swift proxy, account, container servers, you perform the following steps. The details of each step are described later:

ul.li: Determine if the example input model already contains a suitable server role (usually in data/server_roles.yml)

If not, you must add a suitable server role as described in Creating Server Role for Swift Servers. As part of this process you will also allocate drives to store object data as described in Allocating Disk Drives for use by Swift
Determine if the example input model has a cluster assigned to Swift proxy, account, container servers (usually in data/control_plane.yml)
If not, you must add a suitable cluster as described in Creating an Proxy, Account, Container Cluster
Identity the physical servers and their IP address and other detailed information
If you use Cobbler, you add these details the baremetal-servers list (usually in data/baremetalConfig.yml). Otherwise, you add these details to servers list (usually in data/server.yml)
As with all servers, you must also verify and/or modify the server-groups information (usually in data/server_groups.yml)

body.p: The only part of this process that is unique to Swift is the allocation of disk drives for use by the object ring as described in Allocating Disk Drives for use by Swift.
